answers.answer: Didn't anyone do a blood glucose test? Ketones in the urine can be a sign of very high blood sugars. It also, I believe, occurs from infections which it sounds like your son may have? I really don't know anything about the urology issues, but if you suspect diabetes you should have his blood glucose tested as soon as possible.

question: Hi, I had my 5 year old son in the ER, and his bloodwork came vack with a highly elevated white blood count, his temp. was 103.8, also his urine came back and it had blood, protein and ketones in it, they are going to do repeat UA in a couple days. Also, 1 of his testicles hasn't came down yet, they are sending him to a child Urologist. Any suggetions on anything i can do?
title: does my child possibly have diabetes?
